Summary: This one is NOT all that good
text:
We were happy to see a flavor of instant tea from Lipton that didn't have aspartame in it.
Mind you, this tea has THREE sweeteners in it - really? Did it really need so much?
I vote a resounding NO. Lipton at least didn't load this one up with aspartame, which is a shocker,
but they did use plenty of other sweeteners, then added SUCRALOSE too. Too much. Way too much.

The honey adds a really pleasant smooth taste to the tea. Most of us at our house like pomegranate and
love blackberries, so thought how bad could it really be? Answer - BAD.

This tea is more like kool-aid than flavored tea.
The color is a medium pinkish red, not anything like tea and more like kool-aid.
The taste is overly fruity, with hardly any tea taste at all. We tried adding some
other instant plain tea to it, and it helped somewhat so the box was not a total loss.

Would we buy it again? Nope, not this one.
What could have been a healthy, refreshing tea drink ended up being more of a glass of kool-aid
instead. We'll pass.
